ground_truth: He raises it to his lips to find that it's already been drunk. He tips it upside down, and its little umbrella falls to the floor. Back inside, Harry staggers up to him. He slaps Peter's face a second time. Peter's head swings to one side, then he turns to face Harry. The two eyeball each other before Harry, tight-lipped, turns and walks away. Peter lowers his head. Her arms folded, MJ looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud. She opens the palm of her hand towards John and moves up to the podium to join him, watched by a stunned Peter. Peter raises the camera to his eye. The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for Spider-Man to swing slowly and gently through the city. He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist. He tries again and again, then falls. He lands face down in a puddle. Rises, pulls off the mask then flexes his wrists. Still nothing happens. He studies his fingertips, then looks up at the building to his right. Standing alone in an alley, he moves to the building. Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb. He moves rapidly up the outside of the building, climbing with ease. He starts to slip down, then comes to a halt. Grasping for a handle, he slips back into the puddle. He shakes his wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip. He notices a newspaper hanging over the side. He grabs it and screws up his eyes to try to read the headline and focus on the picture. In his room, he tosses it away. Looking dejected, Peter sits on his bed. He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow. Octavius is at the desk in his lab, the four mechanical limbs busying themselves around him. One holds a cigar to his mouth. Another lights it for him. Octavius raises the dark glasses he's wearing from his eyes. Puffs on the cigar, then blows the match. Louise and MJ in a shoe store. Peter's at his doctor being examined. He points to his head. The doctor nods, then heaves himself up onto the examination couch to sit beside Peter. He nods again, and Peter reflects. Peter sits in his room, his head against the wall. Big flashes illuminate the darkness. Peter's eyes are bright. Sitting in the front seat of a car, the old man holds out his hand. Peter looks at the hand, only inches from him. He purses his lips. His face screws up and his eyes flicker. He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who stares right back at him, a sad expression on his face.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He lifts it to his mouth to discover that it's already been consumed. He tilts it upside down, and its tiny parasol drops to the ground. Back inside, Harry totters up to him. He smacks Peter's face a second time. Peter's head sways to one side, then he rotates to face Harry. The two glare at each other before Harry, tight-lipped, pivots and strides away. Peter lowers his head. Her arms crossed, MJ appears slightly agitated as the attendees applaud. She opens the palm of her hand towards John and advances to the platform to accompany him, observed by a shocked Peter. Peter lifts the camera to his eye. The lights of the Empire State Building create the scenery for Spider-Man to swing slowly and gently through the metropolis. He extends his right hand and bends his wrist. He attempts repeatedly, then tumbles. He lands face down in a puddle. Rises, removes the mask then bends his wrists. Still nothing occurs. He examines his fingertips, then glances up at the building to his right. Standing solitary in an alley, he proceeds to the building. Places his hands on its exterior and begins to ascend. He moves rapidly up the outside of the building, climbing with effortlessness. He begins to slip downward, then comes to a stop. Grasping for a handle, he slips back into the puddle. He shakes his damp hands and leans back against a trash container. He notices a newspaper hanging over the side. He seizes it and squints to attempt to read the headline and concentrate on the picture. In his room, he tosses it away. Looking dispirited, Peter sits on his bed. He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow. Octavius is at the desk in his laboratory, the four mechanical appendages occupying themselves around him. One holds a cigar to his mouth. Another ignites it for him. Octavius lifts the dark spectacles he's wearing from his eyes. Puffs on the cigar, then extinguishes the match. Louise and MJ in a shoe store. Peter's at his physician being inspected. He gestures to his head. The physician nods, then hoists himself up onto the examination couch to sit beside Peter. He nods again, and Peter considers. Peter sits in his room, his head against the wall. Big bursts illuminate the darkness. Peter's eyes are bright. Sitting in the front seat of a car, the elderly man extends his hand. Peter gazes at the hand, only inches from him. He purses his lips. His face contorts and his eyes flutter. He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who stares right back at him, a sorrowful expression on his face.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He raises it to his lips, finding it empty. Tipping it upside down, the little umbrella falls. Inside, Harry staggers over and slaps Peter's face again. Peter's head swings, then he faces Harry. They stare at each other before Harry walks away. Peter lowers his head. MJ, arms folded, looks flustered as guests applaud. She gestures towards John and approaches the podium, watched by a stunned Peter. Peter raises his camera. The Empire State Building's lights backdrop Spider-Man swinging gently through the city. He stretches his hand, flexes his wrist but falls, landing in a puddle. Rising, he removes his mask and flexes his wrists again. Nothing happens. He studies his fingertips, gazes at a building, and climbs it rapidly, then starts to slip. Grasping for a handle, he falls back into the puddle. Shaking his wet hands, he leans against a skip. He notices a newspaper, grabs it, and squints at the headline. In his room, he tosses it aside. Dejected, Peter sits on his bed, wiping his brow. Octavius is at his lab desk, four mechanical limbs busy. One holds a cigar; another lights it. Octavius raises his glasses, puffs the cigar, then blows the match. Louise and MJ are at a shoe store; Peter at his doctor's. The doctor nods and sits beside Peter, who reflects. In his room, Peter leans against the wall as big flashes illuminate the darkness, his eyes bright. In a car, an old man extends his hand. Peter looks at it, inches away, purses his lips, and turns his gaze to Uncle Ben, who stares back with a sad expression.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He raises the cup to his lips, finds it empty, tips it upside down, and the umbrella falls. Inside, Harry staggers to him, slaps Peter's face again, Peter turns to Harry, they stare, then Harry walks away. MJ, flustered, watches as guests applaud, opens her hand to John, and joins him on the podium while Peter, stunned, raises his camera. Spider-Man swings gently through the city against the Empire State Building backdrop. He extends his right hand, flexes his wrist, but falls into a puddle. Rising, he removes the mask, flexes his wrists, but nothing happens. He examines his fingertips, looks up, climbs a building but slips back into the puddle. He shakes his hands, leans against a skip, notices a newspaper, tries to read it, and tosses it away. Peter sits dejectedly on his bed, wipes his forehead. Octavius at his lab desk, limbs busy, one holding a cigar, another lighting it. Octavius raises his glasses, puffs, and blows out the match. Louise and MJ are in a shoe store. Peter is at the doctor, points to his head, the doctor nods, sits beside him, nods again, and Peter reflects. In his room, Peter sits, head against the wall, flashes illuminate the darkness, his eyes bright. An old man in a car extends his hand, Peter looks, purses his lips, his face contorts, eyes flicker, and he turns to Uncle Ben, who stares back sadly.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He carefully raises the drink to his lips, only to discover that its contents have already been consumed. A bit disoriented, he tips the glass upside down, causing the tiny decorative umbrella to tumble to the floor. Meanwhile, back inside the room, Harry unsteadily approaches him. With unexpected force, Harry slaps Peter across the face for a second time. Peter's head snaps to the side, but he soon turns back to face Harry. The two exchange intense glances, locked in a silent standoff, until Harry, with a tight-lipped and resolute expression, turns on his heel and walks away. Peter lowers his head, feeling a mix of emotions. MJ, standing with her arms folded, appears somewhat flustered as she observes the scene, the guests' applause filling the room. She opens her hand towards John as a gesture of readiness and moves up to the podium to stand beside him, all under the watchful and stunned eyes of Peter. With determination, Peter lifts the camera to his eye. Against the stunning backdrop of the Empire State Building's lights, Spider-Man swings with grace and gentleness through the vast expanse of the city. He extends his right hand and flexes his wrist in an attempt to activate his webbing. He tries repeatedly, yet to no avail, and ultimately falls, landing face down in a waiting puddle. Drenched, he rises and peels off his mask, flexing his wrists once more. Still, nothing seems to happen. He examines his fingertips with curiosity and concern before casting a glance up at the towering building beside him. Alone in the alley, he makes his way toward the building. Placing his hands firmly against its surface, he begins to climb. With surprising speed and ease, he moves upward along the building's exterior. Suddenly, he starts to slip, bringing his rapid ascent to a halt. Grasping desperately for a hold, he ends up back in the puddle. He shakes his dripping hands in frustration and leans against a nearby rubbish skip for support. His attention is drawn to a newspaper dangling over the edge of the skip. He grabs it and squints his eyes in an effort to read the headline and focus on the accompanying pictures. Once in his room, he tosses the paper aside, feeling dejected. Peter sits heavily on his bed, allowing his shoulders to sag. He lifts the back of his left hand to his forehead to wipe away the perspiration gathering there. Meanwhile, Octavius is in his lab, occupied at his desk with the four mechanical limbs bustling around him. One of these limbs holds a cigar up to his mouth, while another efficiently lights it for him. Octavius adjusts the dark glasses shielding his eyes and takes a deep puff on the cigar, casually blowing out the match. In a shoe store, Louise and MJ shop together. At the same time, Peter is at the doctor's office, undergoing an examination. He gestures to his head, indicating some concern. The doctor, understanding, nods in acknowledgment and shifts his weight to sit on the examination couch beside Peter, nodding once more as Peter considers the situation. Peter finds himself alone in his room, resting his head against the wall. Bright flashes intermittently illuminate the darkness surrounding him, making Peter's eyes gleam with reflected light. Sitting in the front seat of a car, an old man extends his hand towards Peter, the proximity only inches away. Peter looks at the hand, his lips pursed in contemplation. His face contorts, and his eyes flicker with emotion. He then turns his gaze toward Uncle Ben, who stares back at him with a look of deep sadness etched across his features.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With deliberate care and precision, he gently raises the drink toward his lips, only to suddenly realize, much to his surprise, that the liquid that had once filled the glass container has already been completely consumed. Feeling slightly disoriented by the unexpected discovery, he tilts the glass completely upside down, which causes the tiny decorative umbrella perched within to gracefully tumble and fall to the floor below. Meanwhile, back inside the room, Harry approaches him with an unsteady gait. With a force that is both unexpected and surprising, Harry delivers a sharp slap across Peter's face for the second time. Peter's head jerks sharply to the side from the impact, but he quickly turns back to face Harry with resolve. The two engage in an intense exchange of glances, locked together in a silent yet profound standoff, until Harry, wearing a tight-lipped expression and filled with determination, turns resolutely on his heel and walks away. Lowering his head, Peter is left grappling with a tumultuous mix of emotions. MJ, standing nearby with her arms folded across her chest, looks somewhat flustered as she observes the unfolding scene while the sound of applause from the guests fills the room. She extends her hand towards John in a gesture of readiness and makes her way up to the podium to stand beside him, all under the watchful and stunned gaze of Peter. With a sense of determination, Peter directs the camera to his eye. Against the stunning and breathtaking backdrop of the Empire State Building's lights, Spider-Man swings with an extraordinary grace and gentleness through the vast expanse of the city. He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist, trying to activate his webbing mechanism. Despite repeated attempts, he is unsuccessful and ultimately falls, landing face down in a waiting puddle below. Drenched and soaking wet, he rises to his feet and peels off his mask, flexing his wrists once more. Yet, still, nothing seems to happen. He examines his fingertips with both curiosity and concern before casting an upward glance at the tall, imposing building beside him. Alone in the alleyway, he makes his determined way toward the towering structure. Placing his hands firmly against its rough surface, he begins to climb. With surprising speed and unexpected ease, he moves upward along the building's exterior. Suddenly, he starts to slip, abruptly halting his rapid ascent. Grasping out desperately for a secure hold, he ends up back in the familiar puddle. He shakes his dripping hands in frustration and leans against a nearby rubbish skip for support. His attention is drawn to a newspaper dangling precariously over the edge of the skip. He grabs it and squints his eyes in an effort to read the headline and focus on the accompanying pictures. Once he is back in his room, he tosses the paper aside in a gesture of dejection. Peter sits heavily on his bed, allowing his shoulders to sag under the weight of his emotions. He lifts the back of his left hand to his forehead to wipe away the perspiration gathering there. Meanwhile, elsewhere, Octavius is engrossed in his lab, occupied at his desk with the four mechanical limbs bustling energetically around him. One of these mechanical limbs holds a cigar up to his mouth, while another efficiently lights it for him. Octavius adjusts the dark glasses shielding his eyes and takes a deep puff on the cigar, casually blowing out the match in a relaxed manner. In a nearby shoe store, Louise and MJ shop together. Simultaneously, Peter finds himself in the doctor's office, undergoing a thorough examination. He gestures to his head, indicating some concern he has. The doctor, understanding, nods in acknowledgment and shifts his weight to sit on the examination couch beside Peter, nodding once more as Peter contemplates the situation. Peter finds himself alone again in his room, resting his head wearily against the wall. Bright flashes intermittently illuminate the darkness surrounding him, causing Peter's eyes to gleam with reflected light. Sitting in the front seat of a car, an old man extends his hand towards Peter, the proximity so close it's mere inches away. Peter looks at the hand, his lips pursed in contemplation. His face contorts with emotion, and his eyes flicker with a complex mix of feelings. He then turns his gaze slowly toward Uncle Ben, who stares back at him with a look of deep, profound sadness etched across his features.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He lifts the glass to his lips, only to realize it is empty, and as he tilts it upside down, a small umbrella tumbles to the floor. Inside once more, Harry, unsteady on his feet, approaches him, and for a second time, he strikingly slaps Peter across the face, causing Peter's head to swing to one side. Peter then slowly turns his head back to face Harry, where they silently lock eyes in a tense stare-down before Harry, with pursed lips, decides to turn his back and walk away. Observing this, Peter lowers his head in resignation while MJ stands with her arms crossed, looking slightly flustered as the crowd breaks into applause. She opens her hand toward John, indicating her intention to join him and makes her way up to the podium, all under the watchful, stunned gaze of Peter. Peter then lifts his camera to his eye, framing the scene with the iconic lights of the Empire State Building serving as the backdrop for Spider-Man, who gently swings through the cityscape. As Spider-Man stretches out his right hand, he flexes his wrist in an attempt to release webbing, but after multiple attempts, finds himself falling and landing face down in a puddle. Rising from the ground, he removes his mask and flexes his wrists repeatedly, but to no avail. He scrutinizes his fingertips, looks up at the imposing building to his right, and standing alone in the dingy alley, moves toward it. Placing his hands on its surface, he begins to scale the building rapidly, initially climbing with effortless agility until he suddenly starts to slip, ultimately halting his descent. In a frantic attempt to regain his grip, he reaches for a handle but instead slips into the puddle once more, shaking his wet hands in frustration. Leaning back against a rubbish skip, he notices a newspaper precariously draped over the side. He snatches it up, squinting his eyes to focus on the headline and picture before discarding it in his room. Feeling disheartened, Peter sits on his bed, wipes his brow with the back of his left hand, and sighs. Meanwhile, Octavius sits at his lab desk, surrounded by the bustling activity of his four mechanical limbs; one offers him a cigar while another lights it. Octavius then raises the dark glasses from his eyes, takes a puff of the cigar, and extinguishes the match. Elsewhere, Louise and MJ browse in a shoe store, and Peter finds himself at the doctor's office undergoing an examination. Pointing to his head, he watches as the doctor nods and then, with some effort, climbs onto the examination couch to sit next to Peter, nodding again as Peter ponders his situation. Later, Peter sits in his room, his head resting against the wall, as bright flashes illuminate the dark space, making his eyes glint with a mix of emotions. In the front seat of a car, an old man extends his hand toward Peter, who looks at it, only inches away, pursing his lips as his face contorts with thought and his eyes flicker with uncertainty. He then shifts his gaze to Uncle Ben, who returns Peter’s look with a sad expression fixed on his face, conveying a wordless exchange laced with deep emotion.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Peter realizes his drink is already empty, as the umbrella drops to the floor. Inside, Harry approaches him, slaps his face once more, and they exchange a tense look before Harry walks away, leaving Peter dejected. MJ, feeling flustered, acknowledges the guests' applause, joins John at the podium, and Peter, stunned, captures the moment with his camera. Meanwhile, Spider-Man swings through the city, using the Empire State Building as a backdrop. Struggling to activate his webbing, he attempts several times, falls, and lands face down in a puddle. Rising, he removes his mask and examines his fingertips before attempting to climb a building with ease. However, he slips back into the puddle, notices a newspaper, and strains to read its headline. Feeling dejected, Peter sits on his bed, wiping his brow with his hand. In Octavius's lab, mechanical limbs assist him, with one lighting his cigar. Octavius raises his glasses and puffs on the cigar. In a shoe store, Louise and MJ browse, while Peter is examined by his doctor, who sits beside him, confirming Peter's concerns. Later, Peter sits in his room amidst bright flashes, lost in thought. In a car, the old man extends his hand to Peter, whose face contorts as he gazes at Uncle Ben's sad expression staring back at him.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He raises it to his lips to find that it's already been drunk, the remnants of a celebratory cocktail from the party. He tips it upside down, and its little umbrella, a classic garnish in tropical drinks, falls to the floor. Back inside, Harry, Peter's old friend from college now estranged, staggers up to him. He slaps Peter's face a second time. Peter's head swings to one side, then he turns to face Harry. The two eyeball each other before Harry, tight-lipped, turns and walks away, his frustration stemming from a deep-seated rivalry. Peter lowers his head. Her arms folded, MJ, who has recently started a successful career in fashion, looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud for an unrelated reason. She opens the palm of her hand towards John, a rising star in the city’s political scene, and moves up to the podium to join him, watched by a stunned Peter. Peter raises the digital camera to his eye. The lights of the Empire State Building, an iconic feature of New York City’s skyline, form the backdrop for Spider-Man to swing slowly and gently through the city. He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist, attempting to shoot his web. He tries again and again, then falls. He lands face down in a puddle formed by the recent rain. Rises, pulls off the mask then flexes his wrists. Still nothing happens. He studies his fingertips, then looks up at the building to his right. Standing alone in an alley, he moves to the building. Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb, channeling the abilities that once came so naturally to him. He moves rapidly up the outside of the building, climbing with ease. He starts to slip down, then comes to a halt. Grasping for a handle, he slips back into the puddle. He shakes his wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip, commonly found in New York's narrow alleys. He notices a newspaper hanging over the side. He grabs it and screws up his eyes to try to read the headline which screams of the latest criminal activity, and focus on the picture. In his room, he tosses it away in frustration. Looking dejected, Peter sits on his bed in the small apartment he can barely afford. He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow. Octavius, a genius scientist turned antagonist, is at the desk in his lab, the four mechanical limbs busying themselves around him. One holds a cigar to his mouth. Another lights it for him with precision. Octavius raises the dark glasses he's wearing from his eyes. Puffs on the cigar, then blows the match out with a swift breath. Louise and MJ in a shoe store discussing the latest trends. Peter's at his doctor being examined after experiencing mysterious symptoms. He points to his head. The doctor nods, then heaves himself up onto the examination couch to sit beside Peter. He nods again, and Peter reflects. Peter sits in his room, his head against the wall, feeling the pressure of his dual life. Big flashes illuminate the darkness, possibly the result of city nightlife outside. Peter's eyes are bright, filled with determination despite his struggles. Sitting in the front seat of a car, the old man, whose wrinkled face shows decades of wisdom, holds out his hand. Peter looks at the hand, only inches from him. He purses his lips. His face screws up and his eyes flicker. He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who stares right back at him, a sad expression on his face, reminding Peter of the values he once held dear.

test_cases.description: He raises it to his lips to find that it is already been drunk. He tips it upside down and its little umbrella falls to the floor. Back inside Harry staggers up to him. He slaps Peter's face a second time. Peter's head swings to one side then he turns to face Harry. The two eyeball each other before Harry tightlipped turns and walks away. Peter lowers his head. Her arms folded. MJ looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud. She opens the palm of her hand towards John and moves up to the podium to join him. watched by a stunned Peter. Peter raises the camera to his eye. The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for SpiderMan to swing slowly and gently through the city. He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist. He tries again and again then falls. He lands face down in a puddle Rises pulls off the mask then flexes his wrists. Still nothing happens. He studies his fingertips then looks up at the building to his right. Standing alone in an alley he moves to the building Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb. He moves rapidly up the outside of the building climbing with ease. He starts to slip down then comes to a halt. Grasping for a handle he slips back into the puddle. He shakes his wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. He notices a newspaper hanging over the side. He grabs it and screws up his eyes to try to read the headline and focus on the picture. In his room he tosses it away. Looking dejected Peter sits on his bed. He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow. Octavius is at the desk in his lab. the four mechanical limbs busying themselves around him. One holds a cigar to his mouth. Another lights it for him. Octavius raises the dark glasses he is wearing from his eyes Puffs on the cigar then blows the match. Louise and MJ in a shoe store. Peter's at his doctor being examined. He points to his head. The doctor nods then heaves himself up onto the examination couch to sit beside Peter. He nods again and Peter reflects. Peter sits in his room his head against the wall. Big flashes illuminate the darkness. Peter's eyes are bright. Sitting in the front seat of a car the old man holds out his hand. Peter looks at the hand only inches from him. He purses his lips. His face screws up and his eyes flicker. He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who stares right back at him. a sad expression on his face.

He slaps Peter's face a second time. Peter's head swings to one side then he turns to face Harry. The two eyeball each other before Harry tightlipped turns and walks away. Peter lowers his head. Her arms folded. MJ looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud. She opens the palm of her hand towards John and moves up to the podium to join him. watched by a stunned Peter. Peter raises the camera to his eye. The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for SpiderMan to swing slowly and gently through the city. He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist. He tries again and again then falls. He lands face down in a puddle Rises pulls off the mask then flexes his wrists. Still nothing happens. He studies his fingertips then looks up at the building to his right. Standing alone in an alley he moves to the building Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb. He moves rapidly up the outside of the building climbing with ease. He starts to slip down then comes to a halt. Grasping for a handle he slips back into the puddle. He shakes his wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. The two eyeball each other before the squirrel, tight-lipped, turns and walks away. The fox lowers its head. Her arms folded, the raccoon looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud. The butterfly moves rapidly up the outside of the building, climbing with ease. The butterfly starts to slip down, then comes to a halt. Grasping for a handle, the butterfly slips back into the puddle. The butterfly shakes its wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip. The butterfly notices a newspaper hanging over the side. The butterfly grabs it and screws up its eyes to try to read the headline and focus on the picture. In its room, the butterfly tosses it away. Looking dejected, the parrot sits on its bed. The parrot takes the back of its left hand up to its forehead and wipes its brow. The owl is at the desk in its lab, the four mechanical limbs busying themselves around the owl. One holds a cigar to the owl's mouth. Another lights it for the owl. The owl raises the dark glasses it's wearing from its eyes. Puffs on the cigar, then blows the match. The elephant and the raccoon in a shoe store. The parrot's at its doctor being examined. The parrot points to its head. The doctor nods, then heaves itself up onto the examination couch to sit beside the parrot. The doctor nods again, and the parrot reflects. The parrot sits in its room, its head against the wall. The parrot purses its lips. Its face screws up and its eyes flicker. The parrot turns its gaze on the bear who stares right back at it, a sad expression on its face.

He studies his fingertips, then looks up at the monument to his right. Standing alone in a garage, he moves to the monument. Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb. He moves rapidly up the outside of the monument, climbing with ease. He starts to slip down, then comes to a halt. Grasping for a railing, he slips back into the sandbox. He shakes his sandy hands and leans back against a bicycle rack. He notices a pamphlet hanging over the side. He grabs it and screws up his eyes to try to read the headline and focus on the picture. In his room, he tosses it away. Looking dejected, Peter sits on his couch. He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow. Octavius raises the goggles he's wearing from his eyes. Puffs on the pastry, then blows the candle. Louise and MJ in a toy store. Peter's at his dentist being examined. He points to his cheek. The dentist nods, then heaves himself up onto the examination chair to sit beside Peter. He nods again, and Peter reflects. Peter sits in his room, his head against the window. Big flashes illuminate the darkness. Peter's eyes are bright. Sitting in the front seat of a bus, the old man holds out his hand. Peter looks at the hand, only inches from him. He purses his lips. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He lowers it from his lips to find that it's already been filled. He shakes it right side up, and its little umbrella rises to the ceiling. Back inside, Harry dances up to him. He taps Peter's shoulder a second time. Peter's head nods to one side, then he leans to face Harry. The two smile at each other before Harry, tight-lipped, spins and dashes away. Peter lifts his head. Her arms extended, MJ appears slightly amused as the guests cheer. She closes the palm of her hand towards John and descends from the podium to join him, watched by a bemused Peter. Peter lowers the camera from his eye. The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for Spider-Man to crawl slowly and gently through the city. He curls up his right hand and twists his wrist. He tries again and again, then stumbles. He drops face-first into a puddle. Stands, puts on the mask then twists his wrists. Still, nothing changes. He examines his fingernails, then glances up at the building to his left. Standing alone in an alley, he drifts to the building. Presses his feet on its surface and begins to descend. He moves sluggishly down the outside of the building, sliding with ease. He starts to climb up, then comes to a stop. Reaching for a handle, he climbs back out of the puddle. He wipes his wet hands and leans forward against a rubbish skip. He discards a newspaper hanging over the side. He unfolds it and opens his eyes to try to read the headline and gaze at the picture. In his room, he holds onto it. Looking buoyant, Peter stands by his bed. He takes the back of his left hand up to his chin and scratches his cheek. Octavius is at the desk in his lab, the four mechanical limbs organizing themselves around him. One offers a cigar from his pocket. Another extinguishes it for him. Octavius lowers the dark glasses he's wearing over his eyes. Sucks on the cigar, then extinguishes the match. Louise and MJ in a shoe store. Peter's at his doctor being encouraged. He waves to his head. The doctor shrugs, then lowers himself down from the examination couch to stand beside Peter. He shrugs again, and Peter contemplates. Peter stands in his room, his head against the ceiling. Small glimmers darken the brightness. Peter's eyes are dim. Sitting in the back seat of a car, the old man pulls in his hand. Peter glances at the hand, several feet from him. He widens his lips. His face smooths out and his eyes sparkle. He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who smiles right back at him, a joyful expression on his face.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The mailbox raises it to its hinges to find that it's already been painted. The mailbox tips it upside down, and its little flag falls to the floor. Back inside, the cat staggers up to the mailbox. The cat slaps the toaster's side a second time. The toaster's dial swings to one side, then it turns to face the cat. The two eyeball each other before the cat, tight-lipped, turns and waddles away. The toaster lowers its handle. Her wheels folded, the bicycle looks slightly flustered as the marbles applaud. The bicycle opens the top of its basket towards the chair and moves up to the stage to join the chair, watched by a stunned toaster. The toaster raises the telescope to its lens. The lights of the Eiffel Tower form the backdrop for the squirrel to leap slowly and gently through the trees. The mailbox stretches out its right hinge and flexes its lid. The mailbox tries again and again, then tumbles. The mailbox lands face down in a ditch. Rises, pulls off the hat then flexes its hinges. Still nothing happens. The mailbox studies its bolts, then looks up at the chimney to its right. Standing alone in a park, the mailbox moves to the chimney. Places its hinges on its surface and starts to climb. The mailbox moves rapidly up the outside of the chimney, climbing with ease. It starts to slip down, then comes to a halt. Grasping for a latch, the mailbox slips back into the ditch. The mailbox shakes its wet hinges and leans back against a wheelbarrow. The mailbox notices a magazine hanging over the side. The mailbox grabs it and screws up its lenses to try to read the headline and focus on the image. In its attic, the mailbox tosses it away. Looking dejected, the toaster sits on its shelf. It takes the back of its left hinge up to its roof and wipes its panel. The kite is at the mantle in its workshop, the four plastic blades busying themselves around it. One holds a donut to its string. Another lights it for the kite. The kite raises the dark visor it's wearing from its strings. Puffs on the donut, then blows the spark. The giraffe and the bicycle in a hat store. The toaster's at its mechanic being inspected. It points to its dial. The mechanic nods, then heaves itself up onto the inspection bench to sit beside the toaster. It nods again, and the toaster reflects. The toaster sits in its attic, its dial against the wall. Big flashes illuminate the darkness. The toaster's lenses are bright. Sitting in the front seat of a wagon, the horse holds out its hoof. The toaster looks at the hoof, only inches from it. It purses its lid. Its face screws up and its lenses flicker. It turns its gaze on the teacher who stares right back at it, a sad expression on the teacher’s face.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She lifts it to her nose to discover that it's already been consumed. She shakes it upside down, and its little umbrella flutters to the ground. Outside, Sally stumbles up to her. She pinches James's nose a second time. James's head tilts to one side, then he pivots to face Sally. The two glare at each other before Sally, tight-lipped, spins and dances away. James lowers his chin. His legs crossed, Anna looks slightly perplexed as the audience cheers. She extends the back of her hand towards Kyle and slides up to the platform to join him, observed by a bewildered James. James lifts the binoculars to his forehead. The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for Batman to glide carefully and smoothly through the city. He reaches out his left foot and taps his ankle. He attempts again and again, then collapses. He lands on his back in a fountain. Stands, removes the helmet then taps his ankles. Still nothing happens. He examines his knuckles, then glances up at the skyscraper to his left. Standing alone in a corridor, he wanders to the skyscraper. Places his feet on its edge and begins to scale. He crawls swiftly up the outside of the skyscraper, scaling effortlessly. He starts to slide down, then comes to a stop. Reaching for a railing, he slips back into the fountain. He waves his wet feet and reclines back against a bicycle rack. He notices a flyer draped over the side. He snatches it and squints to try to decipher the headline and focus on the image. In his den, he hurls it away. Looking gloomy, James stands on his table. He takes the edge of his right hand up to his chin and rubs his cheek. Arthur is at the counter in his garage, the four robotic arms tinkering around him. One holds a pencil to his cheek. Another sharpens it for him. Arthur lowers the spectacles he's wearing to his nose. Scribbles with the pencil, then tosses the sharpener. Karen and Anna in a bakery. James's at his counselor being scrutinized. He gestures to his chest. The counselor winks, then rolls himself up onto the examination couch to lean beside James. He winks again, and James contemplates. James rests in his closet, his knees against the ceiling. Big waves illuminate the shadow. James's hair is shiny. Sitting on the rear seat of a bus, the young girl holds out her foot. James stares at the foot, only inches from him. He tightens his jaw. His face contorts and his knees twitch. He turns his attention to Aunt May who gazes directly at him, a sympathetic expression on her face.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He lowers it to his fingers to find that it's already been eaten. He tosses it upside down, and its little feather floats to the floor. Back outside, Harry crawls up to him. He pats Peter's shoulder a second time. Peter's arm flails to one side, then he spins to face Harry. The two smile at each other before Harry, grinning, turns and hops away. Peter lowers his gaze. Her hands clasped, MJ looks slightly amused as the guests cheer. She closes the palm of her hand towards John and dances up to the stage to join him, watched by an amazed Peter. Peter lowers the book to his lap. The stars of the Milky Way form the backdrop for Spider-Man to float slowly and gently through the air. He reaches out his left arm and snaps his fingers. He attempts again and again, then crashes. He lands flat on his back in a ditch. Gets up, removes the hat then snaps his fingers. Still nothing occurs. He examines his palm, then gazes up at the tree to his left. Standing alone in a park, he strolls to the tree. Places his feet on its trunk and starts to leap. He moves quickly up the side of the tree, jumping with agility. He starts to slide down, then pauses. Clutching for a branch, he tumbles back into the ditch. He wipes his wet sleeves and rests back against a fence. He notices a flyer hanging over the edge. He snatches it and squints his eyes to try to decipher the headline and view the picture. In his bathroom, he flings it away. Looking puzzled, Peter reclines on his couch. He places the back of his right hand up to his ear and scratches his chin. Octavius is at the counter in his kitchen, the four mechanical appendages cooking around him. One holds a candy to his tongue. Another unwraps it for him. Octavius lifts the earphones he's wearing from his head. Chews on the candy, then eats the wrapper. Louise and MJ in a toy store. Peter's at his lawyer being interviewed. He points to his arm. The lawyer smiles, then pushes himself off from the interview desk to stand beside Peter. He smiles again, and Peter contemplates. Peter lies in his kitchen, his feet against the floor. Small glows brighten the shadows. Peter's hands are glowing. Sitting in the rear seat of a bus, the old woman stretches out her arm. Peter glances at the arm, only feet from him. He grimaces. His lips curl and his hands flutter. He turns his eyes on Aunt May who watches right back at him, a joyful expression on her face.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She lowers it to her toes to discover that it's already been eaten. She shakes it sideways, and its tiny balloon drifts to the ceiling. Outside in the garden, Sally dances down to her. She pats Emily's knee a third time. Emily's foot twitches to the left, then she spins to glare at Sally. The pair wave at each other before Sally, wide-eyed, spins and runs away. Emily lifts her feet. His legs crossed, Jake looks slightly amused as the audience cheers. He closes the heel of his foot towards Mark and skips down to the stage to join him, followed by a bewildered Emily. Emily lowers the paintbrush to her nose. The towers of the Eiffel Tower create the background for Batman to fly swiftly and softly over the ocean. He bends his left foot and wiggles his ankle. He attempts once more and again, then jumps. He lands face up in a dune. Stands, pulls off the hat then wiggles his ankles. Still no reaction occurs. He examines his elbows, then glances down at the ocean to his left. Standing together in a barn, he dances toward the ocean. Places his feet on its waves and begins to swim. He moves leisurely across the surface of the ocean, swimming with difficulty. He begins to float down, then pauses. Reaching for a branch, he floats back into the dune. He shivers his dry feet and bends forward against a boulder. He observes a leaflet draped over the edge. He snatches it and blinks his ears to attempt to read the slogan and concentrate on the drawing. In his kitchen, he places it carefully. Feeling energetic, Emily stands on her couch. She lowers the front of her right foot to her chin and scratches her cheeks. Nathaniel is in the garage with his motorcycle, the two rubber tires amusing themselves around her. One wheels a muffin to her stomach. Another tastes it for her. Nathaniel lowers the bright earrings she's holding over her chin. Chews on the muffin, then drops the lighter. Lucy and Jake in a dress shop. Emily’s at her counselor being questioned. She gestures to her ears. The counselor grins, then lifts herself down onto the office floor to stand beside Emily. She grins again, and Emily muses. Emily stands in her kitchen, her ears against the ceiling. Tiny shadows dim the brightness. Emily’s elbows are heavy. Standing in the back seat of a truck, the young woman closes out his toe. Emily glances at the toe, only feet below him. He opens his eyes. His cheeks calm down and his eyebrows twitch. He drops his vision on Aunt Helen who smiles right back at her, a cheerful look on her forehead.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Peter experiences a series of challenges and reflections. After being slapped by Harry and watched by a flustered MJ, Peter takes photos as Spider-Man swings through the city. Struggling with his powers, he falls and attempts to climb a building, but slips and ends up in a puddle. Frustrated, he examines a newspaper headline but soon discards it. Octavius, occupied with his mechanical limbs in his lab, enjoys a cigar. Meanwhile, Peter visits a doctor to discuss his concerns. Later, he sits in his room, pondering deeply, as an old man stretches out his hand. Peter’s thoughts wander to Uncle Ben, who looks back at him with a sad expression.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: a sad expression on his face He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who stares right back at him His face screws up and his eyes flicker He purses his lips Peter looks at the hand only inches from him Sitting in the front seat of a car the old man holds out his hand Peter's eyes are bright Big flashes illuminate the darkness Peter sits in his room his head against the wall He nods again and Peter reflects The doctor nods then heaves himself up onto the examination couch to sit beside Peter He points to his head Peter's at his doctor being examined Louise and MJ in a shoe store Octavius raises the dark glasses he is wearing from his eyes Puffs on the cigar then blows the match Another lights it for him One holds a cigar to his mouth the four mechanical limbs busying themselves around him Octavius is at the desk in his lab He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow Looking dejected Peter sits on his bed In his room he tosses it away He grabs it and screws up his eyes to try to read the headline and focus on the picture He notices a newspaper hanging over the side He shakes his wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip Grasping for a handle he slips back into the puddle He starts to slip down then comes to a halt He moves rapidly up the outside of the building climbing with ease Standing alone in an alley he moves to the building Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb He studies his fingertips then looks up at the building to his right Still nothing happens He lands face down in a puddle Rises pulls off the mask then flexes his wrists He tries again and again then falls He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for SpiderMan to swing slowly and gently through the city Peter raises the camera to his eye watched by a stunned Peter She opens the palm of her hand towards John and moves up to the podium to join him MJ looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud Her arms folded Peter lowers his head The two eyeball each other before Harry tightlipped turns and walks away Peter's head swings to one side then he turns to face Harry He slaps Peter's face a second time Back inside Harry staggers up to him He tips it upside down and its little umbrella falls to the floor He raises it to his lips to find that it is already been drunk

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: He shakes his wet hands and leans back against a rubbish skip Louise and MJ in a shoe store He nods again and Peter reflects He takes the back of his left hand up to his forehead and wipes his brow MJ looks slightly flustered as the guests applaud Another lights it for him Back inside Harry staggers up to him watched by a stunned Peter Peter's eyes are bright Peter's head swings to one side then he turns to face Harry He raises it to his lips to find that it is already been drunk One holds a cigar to his mouth Grasping for a handle he slips back into the puddle Peter sits in his room his head against the wall Sitting in the front seat of a car the old man holds out his hand He grabs it and screws up his eyes to try to read the headline and focus on the picture Big flashes illuminate the darkness His face screws up and his eyes flicker Still nothing happens He notices a newspaper hanging over the side She opens the palm of her hand towards John and moves up to the podium to join him He slaps Peter's face a second time He tips it upside down and its little umbrella falls to the floor He points to his head Peter lowers his head He purses his lips The doctor nods then heaves himself up onto the examination couch to sit beside Peter a sad expression on his face Octavius is at the desk in his lab He tries again and again then falls Peter looks at the hand only inches from him Her arms folded Octavius raises the dark glasses he is wearing from his eyes Puffs on the cigar then blows the match He stretches out his right hand and flexes his wrist He moves rapidly up the outside of the building climbing with ease He starts to slip down then comes to a halt In his room he tosses it away The lights of the Empire State Building form the backdrop for SpiderMan to swing slowly and gently through the city The two eyeball each other before Harry tightlipped turns and walks away He lands face down in a puddle Rises pulls off the mask then flexes his wrists Peter's at his doctor being examined He studies his fingertips then looks up at the building to his right Looking dejected Peter sits on his bed He turns his gaze on Uncle Ben who stares right back at him the four mechanical limbs busying themselves around him Peter raises the camera to his eye Standing alone in an alley he moves to the building Places his hands on its surface and starts to climb
